intro: Leurocline lithospermoides, commonly known as the rock pepper or stone root, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Leurocline lithospermoides thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
